```{r}

library(dplyr)

```



```{r}
# For more infromation on the variables go to https://github.com/owid/covid-19-data/tree/master/public/data/vaccinations 
x <- read.csv("locations_vaccinations.csv")
y <- read.csv("vaccinations.csv")
z <- read.csv("us_state_vaccinations.csv")
CovidData <- readr::read_csv("owid-covid-data.csv.zip") 

# Note the CovidData is the data included in x, y, and z with other stuff. x y and z are there if you want something more specifc without having to use the CovidData

```
```{r}
CovidData %>% filter(location == 'British Virgin Islands')
```

```{r}

Ratios <- CovidData %>%
  group_by(location) %>%
  summarise(ratio = max(total_vaccinations, na.rm = TRUE)/max(population, na.rm = TRUE), 
            gdp = max(gdp_per_capita, na.rm = TRUE), index1 = max(stringency_index, na.rm = TRUE), 
            density = max(population_density, na.rm = TRUE), index2 = max(human_development_index, na.rm = TRUE)) %>% 
  na.omit() %>%
  filter(is.finite(ratio),is.finite(gdp),is.finite(index1),is.finite(density),is.finite(index2))
Ratios
```


```{r}
#Question 1

ratio2 <- Ratios %>% select(-location) %>% scale()


fviz_nbclust(Ratios, hcut, hc_method = "complete", hc_metric = "euclidean", method = "wss")
```
